core
Class MessageProvider

java.lang.Object
  core.MessageProvider

public class MessageProvider
extends java.lang.Object

Class representing the handler for all sent messages, each message composed in the gui will be handled by the MessageProvider class. If a message should be sent immediately the providers calls the send method of the message superclass, it doesn't care which message type it is. If a message should be sent on a specific time the MessageProvider hands the message over to the MessageScheduler.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Yannik Kopp
See Also:
MessageScheduler

Method Detail

getInstance

public static MessageProvider getInstance()
Returns always the same insance of the MessageProvider object, this is used to make sure only one object of this class is used. This pattern is called singleton.

If no object is existing a new one will be created

Returns:
An instance of and object of the MessageProvider class
See Also:
MessageProvider

sendMessageNow

public java.lang.String sendMessageNow(messageTypes.Message msg)
Send a message after the send button is clicked. The type of the message doesn't matter because this method only calls the send method of the superclass

Parameters:
msg - Message to send
Returns:
tbd
See Also:
MessageProvider

sendMessageLater

public java.lang.String sendMessageLater(messageTypes.Message msg)
Creates a timer task with the MessageScheduler if a message needs to be send at a specific time. It also checks if a reminder should be sent before the original message.

Parameters:
msg - Message to send
Returns:
tbd
